author: John D. McKinnon
title: Inspector General Opens Probe of FCC’s Easing of Media-Ownership Rules
text:
WASHINGTON—A federal inspector general has agreed to investigate actions by federal regulators that might benefit Sinclair Broadcast Group Inc. in its efforts to buy Tribune Media Co., according to a top congressman who requested the probe.
The probe could further complicate the government’s review of the $3.9 billion Sinclair-Tribune deal, which has already run into delays over questions about how the merged company will comply with legal limits on local-station ownership.
...
